title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 April 2009 - XWiki
content:
cypromis\_ joined #xwiki at 00:00  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 00:04  
jvdrean left at 00:05 (Client Quit)  
cypromis left at 00:17 (Read error: 113 (No route to host))  
cypromis\_ left at 00:23 ("Verlassend")  
anamarias left #xwiki at 00:37  
ldubost left at 00:38 ()  
vmassol left at 00:53 ()  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 02:07): Hi tharindu  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 02:07): Just answered your email  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:09): sdumitriu: Thanks :) I will check it  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 02:09): What are you doing up so late/early?  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:12): Np, I just wake up now, we had election yesterday  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:12): thought of just to check results  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 02:13): How is it in there? I keep reading news on GoogleNews about war and civil casualties  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 02:13): Is it as bad as it looks on the web?  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:14): I mean its really getting to a good situation now, we have lots of displaced people now  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:14): people collect things to give them, I mean foods and stuff  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:15): actually the problem is still some people are not able to come out of no-fire-zone LTTE is not allowing to go out  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:17): most of the people got escaped last week neerly 100000 came from there as SLDF captured the front-line of first part of no-fire-zone  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:18): its about 10 sq kms that nearly we think about still 10000-30000 people must be in, that are not allowed to come  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 02:19): I really don't understand why people still have wars  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:20): yep, its shape we have a situation like this here  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:20): \*shame  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:21): its because some silly things people done nearly 25 year ago  
tharindu - (26/04/2009 02:22): still we are suffering. hopefully we could end this very soon and rebuild again ourselves

sdumitriu1 joined #xwiki at 16:11  
sdumitriu left at 16:15 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
evalica joined #xwiki at 16:16  
ChathuraPrabudd1 joined #xwiki at 16:35  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:39): Hai everyone :)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:39): Hello  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:40): Thanks for ur mail :)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:40): You're welcome  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:40): Did it help?  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:40): I send the modified exception.vm  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:40): ya exactly  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:41): I have good understanding abt the action flow now :)  
joenr joined #xwiki at 16:41  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:42): sdumitriu: If u free just send me a feedback to the mail that I send you.:)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:42): Yes, looking at it now  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:43): When I start XWiki the first time, it will create its database schema. With MySQL the tables are using MyISAM. Can I told XWiki to use the InnoDB storage instead of MyISAM?  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:43): Then I can create the patch and finalize the thing :)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:43): ChathuraPrabudd1: It would be nice to have the $msg.get("problemoccured") also in a messageboxstart  
cristinaS left at 16:44 ("I don't like you. But Bersirc 2.2 does. Try it out now. [ http://www.bersirc.org/ - Open Source IRC ]")  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:44): great I'll add it :)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:44): joenr: I'm no mysql expert, but I think you can do that when you create the database  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:45): joenr: Hm, no, "create database" doesn't support that  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:45): Sdumitriu1:is it ok to have the title as "Notice"  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:46): Yes  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:46): joenr: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/storage-engines.html  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:47): I have created the database with: "CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS xwiki DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8 DEFAULT COLLATE utf8\_bin;". Is it ok to set the character set to UTF-8? If I don't do so, CP1252 is used.  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:47): Yes, it's OK  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:47): But you should also change the XWiki encoding  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:48): Edit WEB-INF/xwiki.cfg and WEB-INF/web.xml and search for ISO-8859-1  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:48): xwiki.encoding  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:48): :-)  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:48): Found it.  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:48): And replace with UTF-8  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:48): This will probably be the default for the upcoming 1.9  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:50): joenr: I can't find anything for you, sorry  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:50): You should ask the hibernate guys  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:50): Or, if you can change the database configuration, you can set the default engine globally  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:51): sdumitriu1: Ok. I will try that.  
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:54): Is there a document which lists the used Java libraries and frameworks? Struts, Hibernate and so.  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:55): Yes  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 16:55): Look at META-INF/NOTICE  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 16:57): sdumitriu1: I added the the messageboxstart around $msg.get("problemoccured"). I send the exception.vm   
joenr - (26/04/2009 16:59): Is XWiki using Maven?  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:00): Yes  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:00): How hard was it to make it mavenized?  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:00): Not much  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:01): Fortunately, we have Vincent Massol on board, and he wrote two Maven books: "Maven, A Developer's Notebook" and "Better Builds with Maven"  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:02): So he took care of the switch  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:02): But now we all love it  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:02): Maven is great  
arunreddy - (26/04/2009 17:02): Hello everyone  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:02): Hi arunreddy  
arunreddy - (26/04/2009 17:02): hi sergiu,  
arunreddy - (26/04/2009 17:03): cudn work much last three four days.. coz of school work.. last days at school lots of formalities..   
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:04): No problem  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 17:04  
arunreddy - (26/04/2009 17:05): :)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:06): But it's time to start doing some research for the project  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:07): This drag and drop thing in the Panel Wizard administration is done by prototype and scriptaculous?  
arunreddy - (26/04/2009 17:07): yes , apart from fixing few bugs right.?  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:08): joenr: No, it was done a long long time ago using raw javascript  
tharindu joined #xwiki at 17:13  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:15): Is there a way for syntax highlighting? I only found verbatim on XWikiSyntax.  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:15): ChathuraPrabudd1: The changes are good. Please correct the indentation, and then attach the patch to the Jira issue  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:16): joenr: What do you mean? What kind of syntax highlighting?  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:16): Are you using spaces or tabs for indentation?  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:16): Spaces  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:16): sdumitriu1: Something like this http://pygments.org/.  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:16): We have the code macro that does that  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 17:16): sdumitriu1: Thanks for the help. :)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:17): (and it's using pygments internally)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:17): But that's for displaying code snipets  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:17): {code[:none|:java|:xml|:sql]}  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:18): If you want live syntax highlighting, you can either use XEclipse, or the Mozilla Bespin integration  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:18): It uses pygments? With jython?  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:18): Yes, but not that macro  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:18): That is used with the 1.0 synta  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:18): x  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:18): The 2.0 syntax has its {{code}} macro  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:18): How how how? :-)  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:19): The old {code} macro is doing some plain regexp keywords matching  
sdumitriu1 - (26/04/2009 17:20): Look here: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-macros/xwiki-rendering-macro-code/  
sdumitriu1 is now known as sdumitriu ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection))  
trifon joined #xwiki at 17:23  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:23): Pygments support in XWiki is cool. :-)  
anamarias left at 17:29 ()  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:44): I can't find a section which describes the creation of a skin in the Developer's Guide.  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 17:47): There is one, let me search  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 17:48): search skin  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 17:48): search writing skin  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 17:48): search +writing +skin  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 17:49): joenr: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/XWikiNewSkin  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 17:49): It's still an early draft  
joenr - (26/04/2009 17:50): Thank you.  
tharindu\_ joined #xwiki at 17:55

joenr - (26/04/2009 17:59): You are not using JSPs? Only Velocity?

sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 18:17): joenr: Yes, just velocity

ldubost joined #xwiki at 19:36  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 19:52): hai ldubost :)  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:52): Hi Chathura.. how ae you  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 19:53): fine.Finished the issue u gave to me. How r u :)  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:55): Can you show what the result is as a screenshot  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:55): I think we might want a nicer message  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:56): This is a quite common user error  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 19:57): ok.I discussed with this with Sergiu he said me its look fine.  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:57): ok .. so sergiu can apply it  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:57): You want another one ?  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 19:58): ya whats the next step? If u busy just reply to the thread(survey application). I already send a mail to that :)  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 19:59): ok i'll check later  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 19:59  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 20:00): So drop me a mail regarding the next steps that I hav to follow. :)  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 20:01): ldubost: Thank you :)   
ldubost - (26/04/2009 20:02): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2239  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 20:02): I think this one is good  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 20:03): There should also be no rollback to the current version.. it does not make sense  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 20:03): ok. I'll work on that :)  
ldubost - (26/04/2009 20:06): have fun  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 20:07): ok have a nice day:)  
kaaloo left at 20:08 ("Leaving.")  
cypromis left at 20:13 (Remote closed the connection)  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 20:41  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 20:41): ChathuraPrabudd1: I committed your patch and closed the issue  
sdumitriu - (26/04/2009 20:42): For the next one you chose: its easy to fix, but for a complete solution you'll need to make changes in several places  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 20:42): :)  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (26/04/2009 20:46): I'll first try to figure it out by my self. Hope to get some advice from u tomorrow:)
